page_title: 5 Days Pak-China Border Hunza Trip Package

sections.content: Hunza Valley is one of the top tourist attraction points in Northern Areas Tour Packages. We offer Hunza Valley 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9-day trips to cover all main tourist places. The most historical place to visit in Hunza is the Baltit & Altit Fort with your local tour guide, founded in the 8th century. You can see the mountain diversity of Nagar Valley (Home of Rakaposhi – The Mother of Mist) right from Hunza Karimabad. Trip to Hunza Valley offers many tourist attractions such as Eagles Nest Hunza, Attabad Lake, and Passu Cones. We offer custom Hunza Tour packages, which include comfortable stays at hotels in Hunza in Karimabad, Passu, and Attabad Lake. Visit the Khunjerab Pass (Pakistan-China Border) on a day tour in this package. We have much time to cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge and boating activities at Attabad Lake. Take photographs with the backdrop of Passu Peaks. Karimabad is the capital of Hunza Valley surrounded by the mighty Karakoram mountains. Wake up early to a spectacular sunrise over Rakaposhi, then explore Altit and Baltit forts, and overnight at Eagle’s Nest.

content: Experience the vibrant culture of the local communities in Hunza
Join in traditional dances to the beats of Hunza Valley local drums
Enjoy the unique flavors of Hunzai and Pakistani delicious food
Social interaction with the members of the Hunza ancient community
See famous peaks like Rakaposhi (7,788 m), Passu Sar (7,478 m), Ultar Sar (7,388 m), and Nanga Parbat (8,126 m)
Take part in thrilling water sports at Attabad Lake
Explore the region’s rivers: Hunza, Gilgit, Indus, Kunhar, and streams
See Babusar Pass (4,173 m), Khunjerab Pass (4,733 m), and the Attabad tunnel
Visit valleys: Hunza, Nagar, Naltar, and Naran Kaghan
Enjoy Naltar Valley and Naltar Lakes (Blue Lake, Satrangi Lake)
Explore Attabad, Lulusar, Naltar, Batura, Passu, and Hussaini Suspension Bridge
Wildlife at Khunjerab National Park and Naltar Wildlife Sanctuary
Visits to Altit and Baltit forts
Shopping in Karimabad, Aliabad, and Naran
Travel along the Karakoram Highway and Ancient Silk Route
Discounted price options to improve your experience

Day_1: Departure for Hunza Naran Valley Tour
Pick up from doorstep by our representative
Check in and rest at hotel in Naran/Chillas
Leisure time or explore local markets
Overnight stay at hotel in Naran/Chillas
Day_2: Travel to Hunza from Naran Kaghan Valley
Short stay at Lulusar Lake for photography
Drive to Hunza via Karakoram Highway
Dinner and overnight stay in Hunza
Day_3: Visit Attabad Lake and water sports
Sightseeing of Passu and Shispar Peaks
Shopping at Sost, last northern town
Dinner and overnight stay in Hunza
Day_4: Check out and travel to Naran
Sightseeing: Rakaposhi View Point, Babusar Top
Day_5: Check out and travel via Hazara Motorway
Visit Kiwayi Waterfall and Abshaar Cafe
End of services with unforgettable memories

content: Boating and Jet Ski at Attabad Lake
Blazing Sunrise at Eagle Nest Duikar
Local food taste and organic fruits

content.question: How to book the Hunza Pakistan tour?
content.answer: Pay a 40% advance via bank transfer, Easy Paisa, or Jazz Cash. Foreigners can use Remittance, Western Union, or SWIFT code.

content.question: What is special about Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Known as Heaven on Earth, surrounded by peaks like Rakaposhi, Ultar Sar, Nanga Parbat, with rich culture and historic forts.

content.question: What are the hotel options in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Options include Hunza Elites, Hunza Bliss Hotel, Offto Resort, Famree Resort, Darbar Hotel, Roomy Dastan, Serena Hotel, Luxus Hunza.

content.question: What are the famous fruits of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apples, grapes, cherries, and apricots; apricot flowers bloom in March–April and fruit is harvested in July.

content.question: What are the famous cakes of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apricot Cake at Glacier Breeze and Walnut Cake at Café De Hunza are local favorites.

content.question: What to buy from Hunza Valley?
content.answer: This information is not available in the provided text.

content.question: How to get a tourist visa to visit Hunza?
content.answer: Apply online via NADRA E-Visa or through Western Union/SWIFT; no NOC needed for Gilgit-Baltistan.

content.question: What is Hunza water?
content.answer: Naturally gray-blackish water rich in silica colloids, prized for health benefits.

content.question: Is there any airport in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Flights land at Gilgit (1 hr from Islamabad), then a 3–4 hr drive to Hunza.

content.question: Which mobile networks work in Hunza?
content.answer: Telenor, Zong, and SCOM postpaid networks provide coverage.

content.question: When are the spring and autumn seasons in Hunza?
content.answer: Spring: mid-March to mid-April (blossoms). Autumn: mid-October to mid-November (fall colors).

content.question: What are the best restaurants in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Notable spots include Café De Hunza, Rainbow Restaurant, Pizza Pamir, and local eateries.

content.question: How many days are enough to visit Hunza?
content.answer: A 5–8 day trip allows full exploration at a comfortable pace.

content.question: Is Hunza Valley safe for tourists?
content.answer: Hunza is very safe for local and international visitors due to friendly communities and stable conditions.

content.question: What are the terms & conditions?
content.answer: Check-in 12 pm / check-out 10 am; specified meals only; park fees, tips, and insurance excluded; ID required; rates vary on blackout dates; itinerary subject to change.

content: Accommodation in hotel as per the variant selected
Breakfast and dinner as mentioned in the variant
All toll tax, parking, fuel, and driver allowances
Comfortable and sanitized vehicle for sightseeing
Lunch, tea, and mineral water during travel
Laundry, beverages, phone calls, and personal expenses
Extra expenses due to nature or political reasons
Porter for luggage, medication, evacuation, and rescue
